post.description:
Register a new User and Gaming Group at the same time. Once a User account is created then requests can be made
to the User Sessions resource to give back and authentication token. Registering a new User will
also create a single Player with the same name as the new User. A confirmation email will be 
sent to the email address of the new User.

400.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

example.message: Name 'some username' is already taken.

get.description:
Retrieve basic information for a given User, including their active and inactive Gaming Groups. This service is secured so that only an X-Auth-Token for the requested User
will return a valid response.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The NemeStats unique identifier for the User.

parameters.name: X-Auth-Token

schema.example: the token for the requested user

parameters.example: the token for the requested user

400.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

example.message: This action requires an X-Auth-Token header.

401.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

example.message: Invalid X-Auth-Token

post.description:
Authenticates the given User and gives back an authentication token which can be sent in the X-Auth-Token
header on subsequent requests to the API that require authentication. This authentication token will be valid
for about 3 months or until another request to POST /UserSessions/ invalidates the token (while providing a new one).
You can pass the uniqueDeviceId to get a different authenticationToken per device.
A User Session is represented by an authentication token.

401.description: Unexpected error in API call. See HTTP response body for details.

example.message: Invalid credentials provided.

get.description:
Retrieve a list of Played Games given some criteria. Currently limited to a single Gaming Group at a time
via the required gamingGroupId query string parameter.

parameters.name: gamingGroupId
parameters.description: The NemeStats unique identifier for the Gaming Group of the Played Game.

parameters.name: startDateGameLastUpdated
parameters.description: If set, all Played Games returned will have been updated greater than or equal to this date. Dates must be in yyyy-MM-dd format.

parameters.name: endDateGameLastUpdated
parameters.description: If set, all Played Games returned will have been updated less than or equal to this date. Dates must be in yyyy-MM-dd format.

parameters.name: datePlayedFrom
parameters.description: If set, all Played Games returned will returned will have been played greater than or equal to this date. Dates must be in yyyy-MM-dd format.

parameters.name: datePlayedTo
parameters.description: If set, all Played Games returned will have been played less than or equal to this date. Dates must be in yyyy-MM-dd format.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: If set, will only return Played Games where this Player participated.

parameters.name: exclusionApplicationName
parameters.description: If set, only returns Played Games where there are no Application Linkages with an applicationName matching the specified value. This could be useful for finding any Played Games that did not original from a particular client application. Used in conjuction with startDateGameLastUpdated it could be especially useful for mass synching.

parameters.name: inclusionApplicationName
parameters.description: If set, only returns Played Games where there is an Application Linkage having the specified value. This could be useful for finding any Played Games that originated from the source application so that the unsynched games could be determined on the client side.

parameters.name: maximumNumberOfResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to be returned. The default is no limit.

uniqueDeviceId.description:
A unique identifier for the device of the user. It only needs to be unique in
relation to the other devices that a User may have. For example, this could be used if a User has an iPhone and iPad
and needs to get a different auth token for both. If there can only ever be one client device for the User then this can be omitted.
uniqueDeviceId.example: some unique key for the user's device

userId.description:
NemeStats unique identifier of the newly registered user. May be
used in the future to pull statistics for a given User (but currently has no use in the API).

playerId.description:
NemeStats unique identifier for the corresponding Player
that was created and associated with the newly created User.

playerName.description:
The name of the Player that was just created. Defaults to
the same name of the newly created User.

gamingGroupId.description:
The NemeStats unique identifier of the Gaming Group that was created as part
of the User registration. The new User and Player are automatically placed in this Gaming Group.
This id wiall be important for subsequent requests to the API and should definitely be stored
client-side.

gamingGroupName.description: The name of the newly created Gaming Group.

authenticationToken.description:
The token that should be sent in the X-Auth-Token request header on
subsequent requests to the API that require authentication.

authenticationTokenExpirationDateTime.description:
The date and time (ISO-8601 format) in which the authentication token will expire.
Upon expiration, subsequent requests to the API using this token will return a 401 Not Authorized.

example.message: Name 'some username' is already taken.

message.example: This action requires an X-Auth-Token header.

example.message: This action requires an X-Auth-Token header.

CreateANewUserSessionRequest.title: Create a new User Session request

userName.description: Username of the User being authenticated

password.description: Password of the User being authenticated

uniqueDeviceId.description:
A unique identifier for the device of the user. It only needs to be unique in
relation to the other devices that a User may have. For example, this could be used if a User has an iPhone and iPad
and needs to get a different auth token for both. Getting a new UserSession using the same uniqueDeviceId will override/invalidate the 
previous auth token for that device.
uniqueDeviceId.example: desome unique key for the user's device

CreateANewUserSessionResponse.title: Create a new User Session response

authenticationToken.description: NemeStats unique identifier for the new User

authenticationTokenExpirationDateTime.description:
The date and time (ISO-8601 format) in which the authentication token will expire.
Upon expiration, subsequent requests to the API using this token will return a 401 Not Authorized.

CreateANewUserSession401Response.title: Create a new User Session 401 response

example.message: Invalid credentials provided.

playedGameId.description: NemeStats unique identifier for the Played Game.

gameDefinitionId.description: NemeStats unique identifier for the Game Definition of the Played Game.

gamingGroupId.description: NemeStats unique identifier of the Gaming Group against which this Played Game was recorded.

datePlayed.description: The date that the Played Game was recorded in yyyy-MM-dd format (e.g. 2015-05-013).

dateLastUpdated.description: The date that the Played Game was last updated in yyyy-MM-dd format (e.g. 2015-05-013). This will usually match the datePlayed unless the Played Game was updated at a later date.

playerGameResults.description:
Represents all of the data related to a particular Player's performance in a particular Played Game.
+ playerId (number, required) - NemeStats unique identifier for the Player.
+ playerName (string, required) - The name of the Player.
+ playerActive (bool, required) - Boolean value indicating whether the player is currently Active.
+ gameRank (number, required) - The corresponding integer rank of the Player in this Played Game. A rank of 1 means the Player got first place, 2 means second place, and so on.
+ pointsScored (number, optional) - Decimal number of points the Player scored in the Played Game.
+ nemeStatsPointsAwarded (number, required) - The number of NemeStats Points awarded to the Player for their respective rank in the Played Game.
+ gameDurationBonusNemePoints  (number, required) - The number of bonus NemeStats Points awarded due to the BoardGameGeek average Play Time of this Game Definition.
+ gameWeightBonusNemePoints (number, required) - The number of bonus NemeStats Points awarded due to the BoardGameGeek Weight of this Game Definition.
+ totalNemeStatsPointsAwarded (number, required) - The total number of NemeStats Points awarded including all bonus points.

boardGameGeekObjectId.description: Board Game Geek unique identifier for the Game Definition.

applicationLinkages.description:
Represents a unique identifier for an external application that also stores a representation of this Played Game. For example, if a Played Game is also in BoardGameGeek, the client could set an applicationLinkage with the applicationName = "BGG" and the entityId = "1399193".
+ applicationName (string, required) - Unique identifier for an external application which also holds a representation of this play. Use "BGG" for BoardGameGeek and "BGStats" for Board Game Stats. Other applications can use different application names, so long as they are unique.
+ entityId (string, required) - Unique identifier within the external application. For example, BoardGameGeek has an "id" value for each play which could be passed in this field.

gameDefinitionId.description: NemeStats unique identifier for the Game Definition (e.g. Race For the Galaxy's unique Id) of the Played Game.

playerRanks.description: A collection of PlayerRank objects specifying the game rank and points scored for each Player. See below table for details.

gamingGroupId.description: The NemeStats unique identifier for the Gaming Group where the Played Game will be logged. If no gamingGroupId is specified, the Played Game will be recorded under the default Gaming Group of the currently logged in User.

datePlayed.description: The date the game was played in yyyy-MM-dd format (e.g. 2015-04-29).

notes.description: Any notes or comments that the User wants to record about the game for future reference.

applicationLinkages.description: A collection of ApplicationLinkage objects specifying external identifiers for the Played Game in other systems. Should always have at least one ApplicationLinkage with applicationName = "NemeStats" and entityId = "{NemeStats Played Game Id}".
